title.value: Влияние соломы предшественника, обработки почвы и азотных удобрений на урожайность ярового рапса
Effect of forecrop straw, soil cultivation and nitrogen fertilizers on spring rape yield

journal.title: Arable Farming and Breeding in Belarus : collection of scientific papers

person.name: Bulavin, L.A., National Academy of Sciences (Belarus). Scientific and Practical Center for  Arable Farming

abstract.value: In course of research there was studied possibility of winter rape resowing by spring rape (Brassica napus) in case when winter rape was destructed due to unfavorable weather conditions in autumn and winter. The research was realized in 2010-2012 in the conditions of the central part of the Republic of Belarus on moderately tame sod-podzolic light loamy soil (humus – 2.09-2.29%, P2O5 – 177-211 mg/kg, K2O – 306-366 mg/kg of soil). As a result of realized research it was revealed that at removal of preceeding barley (Hordeum vulgare) straw from the field, spring rape oilseed yield was higher by 13.6- 16.1% after ploughing and chiseling, at entering of nitrogen doses correspondingly N160 and N200, than after disking, and if straw was used as a fertilizer, with application N180, disking was not worse than the above mentioned basic soil cultivation techniques in that what concerned the yield of the above crop. The influence of methods of soil cultivation, straw of previous crop and nitrogen fertilizers on crop yield of oilseeds of spring rape were presented.
